#Text=Calculate an Annual Percentage Growth Rate
#Text=Annual percentage growth rates are useful when considering investment opportunities .
#Text=Municipalities , schools and other groups also use the annual growth rate of populations to predict needs for buildings , services , etc.
#Text=As important and useful as these statistics are , it is not difficult to calculate annual percentage growth rates .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Calculating Growth Over One Year
#Text=Get the starting value .
#Text=To calculate the growth rate , you 're going to need the starting value .
#Text=The starting value is the population , revenue , or whatever metric you 're considering at the beginning of the year .
#Text=For example , if a village started the year with a population of 150 , then the starting value is 150 .
#Text=Get the final value .
#Text=To calculate the growth , you 'll not only need the starting value , you 'll also need the final value .
#Text=That value is the population , revenue , or whatever metric you 're considering at the end of the year .
#Text=For example , if a village ended the year with a population of 275 , then the final value is 275 .
#Text=Calculate the growth rate over one year .
#Text=The growth is calculated with the following formula : Growth Percentage Over One Year =
#Text=Example Problem .
#Text=A village grows from 150 people at the start of the year to 275 people at the end of the year .
#Text=Calculate its growth percentage this year as follows :
#Text=Growth Percentage
#Text=≈
#Text==
#Text=Calculating Annual Growth over Multiple Years
#Text=Get the starting value .
#Text=To calculate the growth rate , you 're going to need the starting value .
#Text=The starting value is the population , revenue , or whatever metric you 're considering at the beginning of the period .
#Text=For example , if the revenue of a company is $ 10,000 at the beginning of the period , then the starting value is 10,000 .
#Text=Get the final value .
#Text=To calculate the annual growth , you 'll not only need the starting value , you 'll also need the final value .
#Text=That value is the population , revenue , or whatever metric you 're considering at the end of the period .
#Text=For example , if the revenue of a company is $ 65,000 at the period , then the final value is 65,000 .
#Text=Determine the number of years .
#Text=Since you 're measuring the growth rate for a series of years , you 'll need to know the number of years during the period .
#Text=For example , if you want to measure the annual revenue growth of a company between 2011 and 2015 , then the number of years is 2015 - 2011 or 4 .
#Text=Calculate the annual growth rate .
#Text=The formula for calculating the annual growth rate is Growth Percentage Over One Year where f is the final value , s is the starting value , and y is the number of years .
#Text=Example Problem : A company earned $ 10,000 in 2011 .
#Text=That same company earned $ 65,000 four years later in 2015 .
#Text=What 's the annual growth rate ?
#Text=Enter the values above into the growth rate formula to find the answer :
#Text=Annual Growth Rate
#Text=≈
#Text== 59.67 % annual growth
#Text=Note — raising a value a to the exponent is equivalent to taking the b th root of a .
#Text=You will likely need a calculator with an " " button , or a good online calculator .
#Text=Quick Summary
